speaker: Skyline
text: Red, yellow, and blue balloons rise over the buildings._   [_Scene 1 - Frasier's apartment. Daphne is answering the door to Roz.  Niles is seated on the couch._]

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Daphne!

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Come on in.

speaker: Roz
text: Is Frasier here?  I need him to approve the latest version of his bio.

speaker: Niles
text: [_taking it from Roz_] Why does he keep updating his bio?  What's changed in the last few years. [_reading_] Oh, his date of birth! He's now four years younger than I am.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, that's silly.  Does everyone fake their age in radio?

speaker: Roz
text: [_with anxiety_] No! [_Daphne chuckles._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Roz, sit down.  I'm glad you're here.  There's something we want to ask you. [_Roz sits between Daphne and Niles._] When Niles and I get married, it would make us very happy if you would serve as maid of honor.

speaker: Roz
text: [_flattered_] Really?  I'm so touched.  I don't know what to say. Well, of course, of course I'll do it. [_She embraces Daphne._]

speaker: Niles
text: Now, uh, set aside September 1st.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, is that Labor Day weekend?

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, is that a problem.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, there's this picnic that I always go to, and I make the potato salad. [_Daphne and Niles look bemused and slightly hurt during this speech._] What am I saying?  Your wedding is more important than potato salad or any salad! [_She and Daphne embrace again._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Then it's settled!

speaker: Roz
text: I'll make the potato salad the night before, and then I'll get someone...[_off Niles's look_] I'll figure it out.  [_N.B. In fact, Jane Leeves was a bridesmaid at Peri Gilpin's wedding to her husband, artist Christian Vincent._]  [_Frasier enters._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, all!

speaker: Roz
text: Hi!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, look who's here, it's my little brother Frasier!

speaker: Roz
text: I brought your bio.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_hanging his coat_] Oh, yes, well I'll have to deal with that tomorrow, Roz, I've got to be across town in half an hour. I'm previewing a new Benjamin Locklear exhibit and then I'm having dinner with the artist afterward.  Promises to be a very exciting evening!

speaker: Daphne
text: And what lucky lady are you sharing it with?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm going alone.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I'm sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, don't be.  Truth is, I'm a pretty terrific date.  I know when to arrive, I know when to call it a night, and frankly, I always leave myself wanting more. [_He exits, smiling._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, it's too bad Dr. Crane doesn't have anyone to share these things with.

speaker: Roz
text: I know.  When was the last time he seriously dated anyone?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, that would be Claire, but that was months ago.

speaker: Roz
text: We should set him up with someone.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it seems to me he's choosing not to date.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_ignoring him_] I have this friend at yoga he might like.

speaker: Roz
text: No, she sounds flaky.  I have the perfect person for him!

speaker: Niles
text: You know, he's always been completely capable of meeting people on his own.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_again ignoring him_] No, we should go with my person first. You don't have the best track record.

speaker: Roz
text: Me? Whenever you've set me up with guys, I knew they were losers the second I saw them.  They turned out to be bad in bed, too.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, there's no reason why we both can't try to set him up with someone.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, but we have to find someone who's gorgeous, sexy, and smart.  [_Martin enters._]

speaker: Martin
text: Smart's good, but I'm not a fanatic about it. [_He moves to sit in his chair._]

speaker: Daphne
text: It's not for you, it's for Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, even though he's expressed no dissatisfaction with his love life whatsoever, these two have decided to make it their mission to find him a mate.

speaker: Martin
text: It's not a bad idea.  It's been a long time since Frasier was excited about someone.  I kind of miss that spring in his step, you know.  The nervous energy he gets where every first date might be "the one."  The electricity of that 30-point self-inspection before he rolls out of the showroom.

speaker: Niles
text: But he says he's happy!

speaker: Daphne
text: Isn't that what you would have said too before your brother helped bring us together?

speaker: Niles
text: That's my point exactly, let's start calling babes!  [_They all react.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 2 - Frasier's apartment. Daphne and Niles are sitting at the dining table.  Daphne is looking in her datebook._]

speaker: Daphne
text: What about Caroline?  She'd get along great with your brother!

speaker: Niles
text: Is she the one missing a tooth?

speaker: Daphne
text: She had it replaced.  That dental school did a good job too. You can only tell it's fake under a black light. [_Niles glares. She turns to another page._] What about Jennifer?  She's pretty, smart, she has those perky breasts...

speaker: Niles
text: I wouldn't call them perky so much as, uh...[_stopping himself_] I don't remember Jennifer. [_faking an attempt to recollect and then giving it up_] Well, besides, didn't Frasier already go out with her?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, you're right.  Well, that's everyone I know.  Oh, it's too bad.  I was hoping we could help.

speaker: Niles
text: [_reflecting_] There is this one woman I know--Lisa.  She'd be great.  They share a lot of interests.  She even owns a bookstore.

speaker: Daphne
text: You've been holding out on me!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, she's a former patient, so that's kind of an ethical gray area.  I'm not sure I'm comfortable setting her up with Frasier.

speaker: Daphne
text: What if she didn't know you were setting her up?  You could point her out to me and then I could strike up a friendship! We could go out for coffee, see movies, tell each other everything. [_moving to the kitchen_] Maybe I was a little hasty making Roz my maid of honor.

speaker: Niles
text: [_following her to the kitchen_] As soon as she finds out you're my fiancee, well...there's my ethical dilemma again.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, what if they just happened to meet by themselves?

speaker: Niles
text: Like at her bookstore?

speaker: Daphne
text: Exactly.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier is always going into bookstores.  She does own a bookstore. [_rationalizing_] Over time, it's highly probable he would find himself...in her bookstore.  Perhaps I could just place them within range of one another, and I'd just stay out of sight.

speaker: Daphne
text: That'll do.  So what does she look like, anyway?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh my God, she's gorgeous!  She has these...[_sighs and stops himself_] I'd have to check my notes.  [_Niles exits.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 3 - Lisa's Bookstore. A customer is exiting.  Niles is spying in the window, probably looking to see where Lisa is.  Frasier approaches him._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, hi, here we are. [_They enter the bookstore._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's a lovely little bookstore, Niles, but I hardly see how it's worth driving all the way across town.  Doesn't seem to have much of a selection.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, they don't cater to all tastes, but I'm confident you'll find something to confident your interest.  [_On cue, Lisa, the owner, enters from the back carrying a box.  She is dark-haired and pretty.  Niles ducks into an aisle._]

speaker: Niles
text: Um, Frasier, Frasier. [_Frasier approaches him._] Um, Daphne had asked me to provide her with a reading list, you know to broaden her mind.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's admirable.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, and I was thinking of starting with Shakespeare.  And, uh, you have such a grasp of his work, I was wondering if you could help me make a selection.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course, although I'm a bit surprised.  You always considered yourself the more well-versed.

speaker: Niles
text: Well-versed, yes, but you're the expert.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_beaming_] I've waited since third grade to hear you say that!  [_Frasier goes to the back aisle where Lisa is shelving books.  As he enters it, she leaves at the other end and moves to the next aisle toward Niles without Frasier noticing her._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm...  [_Niles covers his face with an open book so that Lisa won't see him and walks past her to Frasier._]

speaker: Niles
text: Um, you know, maybe she'd appreciate Shakespeare more if she knew something about him.  Perhaps a biography.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's good thinking.  [_Frasier walks forward to the next aisle, where Lisa is at the other end.  She simultaneously leaves and moves forward again to the next aisle._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.

speaker: Niles
text: [_following him_] Although, philosophy is the basis of all thought. Any mind-broadening exercise should begin with philosophy.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_seeming a bit confused by Niles's behavior_] Very well.  [_They both move forward.  Lisa again leaves just as Frasier enters.  He still has not noticed her. She has now moved to the aisle from which Niles had grabbed a book._]

speaker: Niles
text: Or sports.  [_Frasier reacts with disbelief. Lisa moves back to the philosophy aisle as Frasier confronts Niles._]

speaker: Niles
text: No, philosophy.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're certain?

speaker: Niles
text: Unquestionably. Go. Go.  [_Frasier is looking at books while Lisa is shelving at the other end. Frasier still takes no heed of her.  She moves toward Frasier, who moves so that she can pass him.  As she does, his back is turned and he is concentrating on the book, so he still really pays her no attention.  She shelves books near Frasier.  She is concentrating on her shelving while Frasier chuckles with "Ah's" about the book he has selected.  They briefly face the same direction.  They then pass each other in the other direction, again with their backs toward each other.  Frasier approaches Niles._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Here we are.  Plato's _Republic._  Can't say I agree with everything in there, but it's a place to start.  [_We now see that the book Niles has taken from the sports section is about NASCAR auto racing._]

speaker: Niles
text: Ooh, there's a little tear in the cover.  Would you get me another copy?

speaker: Frasier
text: Good heavens, Niles, what am I, your lackey?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, no, I-I'm just engrossed in this [_mispronouncing_] "Heroes of Nahz-KAR."  [_Niles feigns deep interest.  Frasier looks at the book with disbelief and shakes his head.  NB: This is an inside joke.  Toward the end of last season, NBC contracted with NASCAR to carry some events.  They then began an ad campaign which spoofed another ad campaign (the product is unimportant) featuring an announcer describing the movie**You've Got Mail** and asking the audience if they had seen it.  The ad then showed a rough-looking western type of man and the announcer said "This guy hasn't seen it."  NBC's take on it went something like this: "You know that show _Frasier_?  It has the two brothers who are psychiatrists and they go to operas and sit drinking Lattes.  You know that show?" All the while, the picture showed shots of auto races and pit stops, etc. A NASCAR driver was then shown.  The announcer continued: "It's on the same network as this guy!"  Kelsey was somewhat irritated at the ad, and this joke with Niles mispronouncing "NASCAR" is meant as a jab at NBC.  This is not the first little stab the writers have taken at the network this season.  For copious examples, see episode [[9.10]](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_10/junior_agent.html "Junior Agent"), "Junior Agent."_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine.  [_He returns to get another copy.  As he does, Lisa passes him yet again with his back turned to her and heads toward the back of the store._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Here you go.  Pristine condition.

speaker: Niles
text: [_defeatedly_] Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, while we're here, I'd like to try to find a book on the early British monarchy.  I've recently read _The Isles: A History,_ and they didn't go into as much detail as I might have liked about the Plantagenets.

speaker: Niles
text: Hmm. [_He sees Lisa approaching them._] Well, um, you know, why don't you ask someone here?  I found the staff her very knowledgeable.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, um, yes, all right, all right, I'll be right back.  [_In the meantime, Lisa, with her back to Niles and Frasier, has begun giving instructions to a geeky-looking male clerk.  As Frasier approaches, Lisa again heads to the back and Frasier confronts the male clerk.  Niles is beside himself._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, excuse me.  Um, do you happen to have a book on the Plantagenets?

speaker: Clark
text: That's like a banana, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Never mind. [_He returns to Niles._]

speaker: Niles
text: Any luck?

speaker: Frasier
text: Finding dunderheads, yes.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well, uh, maybe you should ask someone else.  [_Lisa has returned to the front of the store via the other end of the ailes and is in the sports aisle, now behind Frasier and Niles._]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, um...  [_Lisa has now moved to the cash register._]

speaker: Lisa
text: Can I help the next person?

speaker: Niles
text: Or maybe what we should do is just pay for our books and go.  [_He hands the books to Frasier.  Lisa is helping another customer._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, we just got here!  You're acting very strangely.

speaker: Niles
text: No, I'm not.  [_As Lisa finishes the customer, Niles ducks behind Frasier to avoid Lisa seeing him._]

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell is wrong with you?

speaker: Niles
text: Dizzy spell.

speaker: Frasier
text: There's a footstool in the Shakespeare section.  Why don't you just go have a seat for a minute?

speaker: Niles
text: I'll be fine, you just pay for the books!

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, yes, of course.  [_Niles slinks to the back.  A UPS man arrives with another box of books. Lisa notices and helps him._]

speaker: Lisa
text: Clark, can you take over?

speaker: Clark
text: Sure.  [_Lisa leaves the register as Frasier approaches, and they again pass each other without any notice.  The geeky clerk takes over the register. Lisa accompanies the UPS man to the back._]

speaker: Clark
text: Hello again!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.

speaker: Clark
text: So, did you find what you were looking for?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not really, no.

speaker: Clark
text: OK. [_He begins to ring up Frasier's books._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I have Book-Lover's Discount.

speaker: Clark
text: Ah, we don't accept that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Independent Booksellers?

speaker: Clark
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, Bibliophiles?  Dewey Decimal Discount?  Dust Jacket Gang?

speaker: Clark
text: I'm sorry.  We do have our own card.  It's $25.

speaker: Frasier
text: $25?  For a little card?

speaker: Clark
text: You get 50% off all purchases.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_putting away his cards_] Very well.  How much will I save today?

speaker: Clark
text: The discount starts with your next purchase.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  What kind of a Ponzi scheme are you operating here?

speaker: Clark
text: Store policy. [_We see Niles notice Frasier's raised voice with concern.  He approaches the register._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I would like to speak with the store owner please.

speaker: Niles
text: [_approaching rapidly_] Ooh, what's going on?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm going to give the owner a piece of my mind.

speaker: Niles
text: Ooh, that's all right, that's all right, forget it, I don't want the book.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, you do, you're getting the book!

speaker: Niles
text: No, I don't.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're getting the book _and_ a discount!

speaker: Clark
text: Lisa, we have a card challenge at checkout!

speaker: Niles
text: [_nervously_] No, no, no, challenge withdrawn.

speaker: Frasier
text: Over my protest!

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, look, we're leaving.  Everything's OK.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, all right. [_Niles begins to hurry them out._] You know, by the way, you have an alphabetical misfile, but I'm not telling you where!  [_Frasier and Niles leave.  Clark is a bit ruffled by the confrontation. Lisa does not return.  Fade out._]  _END OF ACT 1   ACT 2_  **Bachelorette #2**  [_Scene 4 - Frasier's apartment. Roz is outside in the hall with a friend whom she means to set up on a blind date with Frasier.  The friend, Susanna, an attractive brunette, is carrying a foil-covered pie._]

speaker: Roz
text: I just know the two of you are going to hit it off.

speaker: Susanna
text: I thought you were always complaining he's such a tight-ass.

speaker: Roz
text: Not complaining, bragging, you know?  That I work with someone whose got such a _tight_ ass! [_She rings the doorbell. Frasier answers._] Frasier! Susanna.  Susanna, this is Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on in!  Roz has told me all about you.

speaker: Susanna
text: She's told me all about you, too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.

speaker: Susanna
text: I thought since you were making dinner, I'd add a little contribution of my own.  It's nothing special, just a key lime pie.

speaker: Roz
text: [_exuberantly_] "Nothing special!" She made the whole thing herself from scratch!  The crust, the meringue--she even baked it in a pie plate she fired in her own home kiln!

speaker: Susanna
text: [_downplaying Roz's compliments_] In my spare time, I use my power of invisibility to fight crime.  [_Frasier laughs._]

speaker: Roz
text: Am I overselling this a little?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just a bit, yes, Roz. Um, I'll just go put this in the kitchen. Why don't you ladies make yourselves comfortable?  [_Susanna approvingly observes Frasier's rear as he heads to the kitchen. Roz smiles encouragingly.  They both crane their necks to keep the view as he moves deeper into the kitchen.  Frasier returns with a bottle._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Would anyone care for some wine?

speaker: Susanna
text: Thank you, sure!

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier knows pretty much everything there is to know about wine. [_exuberantly, selling again_] Tell us some things about wine, Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_teasing Roz_] Sometimes you have to know when to put a cork in it. [_He pours the glasses._] So Roz, where's Roger?

speaker: Roz
text: I don't know.  I'll call him and see what's holding him up. [_strongly encouraging_] You know, Susanna, now would be a good time to show Frasier your portfolio. [_She sits on the arm of the couch and puts her arm around Susanna._] Susanna's an artist. She even has a gallery that shows her paintings exclusively!

speaker: Susanna
text: [_feigning embarassment but clearly pleased with Roz's praise_] It's not so much a gallery as a restaurant-slash-bowling alley.  [_Frasier chuckles and grins widely._]

speaker: Roz
text: [_placing both hands on Susanna's shoulders and hugging her with admiration; with great exuberance_] She's a hell of a bowler too!  Someone better snatch her up before she joins a league and there go her Saturday nights! [_She has given Susanna's shoulders several enthusiastic shakes during this speech._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, go make your call, all right?  [_Roz exits, slightly embarassed at her effusiveness._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_handing Susanna a glass_] Here we are.

speaker: Susanna
text: Thank you.  I don't usually travel with my portfolio, but she made me bring it.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm glad she did.  I actually fancy myself a bit of collector.  I'd love to see it.

speaker: Susanna
text: Oh, all right, but be gentle!

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course.  [_She opens her portfolio as Frasier moves to her side._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_observing_] Oh, boy.  Well that is interesting, it's quite remarkable, really!

speaker: Susanna
text: Thanks, the original's hanging over the shoe rental.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wonderful texture...and these blues...so much sadness.

speaker: Susanna
text: [_flattered_] Most people don't get that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and your elongated figures are actually reminiscent of Modigliani.

speaker: Susanna
text: That's interesting.  I used to love Modigliani as a girl. Maybe I was subconsciously influenced by him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Quite possibly, yes.  I see you're also a fan of Benjamin Locklear.

speaker: Susanna
text: [_suddenly taken aback and defensive_] What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Benjamin Locklear.  He has a show...

speaker: Susanna
text: [_abruptly and nervously interrupting_] I know who he is!  His stuff isn't anything like mine!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, maybe you haven't seen his latest work.  You see, I was just in attendance at his most recent opening.  I purchased a fantastic piece myself. [_He rises and goes to a side table, from which he retrieves a polaroid._] Here, let me show you. Hmm?

speaker: Susanna
text: [_taking the picture and rising_] Oh, my God!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's magnificent, isn't it.  You know, I'm thinking of putting it in my bedroom to set off the duvet.

speaker: Susanna
text: That hack ripped me off!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shocked_] That's quite an accusation.

speaker: Susanna
text: The guy is a thief.  Everyone in the art community knows it.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_defensively_] I consider myself a member of the art community. All I've heard is good things...

speaker: Susanna
text: [_with increasing agitation_] Oh puh-leeze! The guy steals from lesser-known artists and markets himself to suckers with more money than taste!  [_Frasier is obviously deeply offended.  She stops herself, realizing that she has become carried away.  Frasier rises._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_calmly, taking the picture_] You know what.  You're right. Maybe he did copy you. [_instantly venomous, with great disdain_] Maybe he got his inspiration one evening when he was out side-table drawer._]

speaker: Susanna
text: I do not need to be insulted by someone who buys art because it matches his bedspread!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a _duvet_ and you're delusional!

speaker: Susanna
text: Dilettante!

speaker: Frasier
text: Forger!

speaker: Susanna
text: Man who uses the word "duvet!!" [_She marches toward the door with her portfolio._]  [_Roz re-enters._]

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, guys!  How's it going?

speaker: Frasier
text: She is crazy!  That's how it's going.

speaker: Susanna
text: And for your information, Benjamin Locklear is as overrated as your ass! [_She exits in a huff._]

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell was that supposed to mean?

speaker: Roz
text: [_exiting hurriedly_] I have no idea.  Have a nice weekend.  [_Martin enters._]

speaker: Martin
text: What's going on out here?

speaker: Frasier
text: I let Roz set me up on a blind date with one of her friends.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, big waste of time, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there's pie.

speaker: Martin
text: Homemade?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.

speaker: Martin
text: Cherry?

speaker: Frasier
text: Key Lime.

speaker: Martin
text: [_excitedly_] I can live with that!  [_They go to the kitchen._]

speaker: Martin
text: Sorry, son, tough break. [_observing the pie_] Ooh, I bet it's got a lard crust!  Ooh!

speaker: Frasier
text: I brought you a fork, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Thanks!

speaker: Frasier
text: I wish I'd never let Roz set me up on that date.  [_They begin to attack the pie._]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you can't hit the ball unless you take a swing.  Oh!-- Now, there's this gal in the building where I work...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_interrupting_] Dad, Dad.  You're not proposing another blind date?

speaker: Martin
text: Now, she's a beautiful young lawyer, and she couldn't be nicer.

speaker: Frasier
text: I am _not_ interested.

speaker: Martin
text: Now, don't say that.  You've got to see her!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, listen to me. [_suggestively_] You've _got_ to see her!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_giving in_] A young lawyer, you say?  [_Martin laughs.  They continue to devour the Key Lime pie.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 5 - A bar/pool hall. Frasier and Martin's co-worker, Kris, a young blonde, are sitting at the bar._]

speaker: Kris
text: Thanks for meeting me here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure.

speaker: Kris
text: I thought it would be nice to have a drink before dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I don't think I've ever really been here before, but it does have a nice sort of neighborhood feel to it.

speaker: Kris
text: It is my favorite place.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.  So my dad tells me that you're a lawyer.

speaker: Kris
text: Actually, I'm a legal secretary.  But I'm planning to go to law school next fall.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Well, that's admirable. [_The bartender hands him a drink._] Thank you.  Of course, you know, paradoxically, you'll have to _pass_ the bar if you expect to pass the bar.

speaker: Kris
text: [_laughing_] You're so funny!  [_A man enters._]

speaker: Clint
text: Hey, Kris.

speaker: Kris
text: Hey, Clint.

speaker: Clint
text: Nice to see you. Hey, that's a great sweater.

speaker: Kris
text: Oh, thank you!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_a bit uncomfortable_] So, uh, what did my dad tell you about me?

speaker: Kris
text: Oh, he talks about you all the time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, he's very proud of you.  But what he didn't tell me is how good-looking you are.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_flattered_] Well, thank you.  [_The bartender gives Kris a drink._]

speaker: Bartender
text: Compliments of the gentleman in the Hawaiian shirt.

speaker: Kris
text: Thanks, Graham! [_She waves.  Graham waves back._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_again uncomfortable_] So you, uh, you know him?

speaker: Kris
text: [_laughing_] Oh, you know...  [_Frasier clearly doesn't know and is at a loss.  Another man approaches the bar and addresses Kris._]

speaker: Jason
text: Hey, you!

speaker: Kris
text: Hey!

speaker: Jason
text: Wouldn't mind stopping and smelling those roses! [_He refers to Kris's shirt, which is decorated with white flowers._]

speaker: Kris
text: Oh, you are so funny!  [_Frasier again has an uncomfortable reaction.  Kris and Jason are now sitting at the bar with Frasier standing like a potted plant between them._]

speaker: Kris
text: Jason, this is Frasier.  Frasier, Jason.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shaking his hand_] Nice to meet you.

speaker: Jason
text: [_to Kris_] So you owe me a pool game!

speaker: Kris
text: Another time.

speaker: Jason
text: Oh, sounds like somebody's scared!

speaker: Kris
text: Yeah, you!  Scared of getting your ass kicked.

speaker: Jason
text: Uh-huh.

speaker: Kris
text: But it'll have to be another time.  I'm on a date.

speaker: Jason
text: Frasier doesn't mind.  You don't mind, do you?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looking at his watch_] Well, uh, actually...

speaker: Jason
text: Thanks, champ.

speaker: Kris
text: I'll be right back!  [_They leave Frasier standing there and go to the pool table._]

speaker: Jason
text: Mind if I break?

speaker: Kris
text: Sure, go ahead.  [_Jason breaks._]

speaker: Kris
text: Looks like you're stripes!

speaker: Jason
text: [_flirtatiously_] And _you_ are definitely solid.

speaker: Kris
text: [_flirting back_] Shut up!

speaker: Graham
text: I got next game!

speaker: Clint
text: I'm after Graham! [_He stands next to Frasier._]

speaker: Frasier
text: So, uh, how do you know Kris?

speaker: Clint
text: Oh, you know...

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I really don't!  [_Another man now stands on the other side of Frasier._]

speaker: Harry
text: I got her next!  Oh, Kris.  I got my car checked out.  You were right.  It was the transmission.

speaker: Kris
text: [_taking a pool shot_] Then you owe me a pitcher!

speaker: Harry
text: Oh!  [_Kris shoots a ball in the corner pocket.  The crowd of men reacts with admiring Ooh's and Aah's._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Harry_] So, you've known Kris a long time.

speaker: Harry
text: Who are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm her date.  [_The balls are heard clacking_]

speaker: Harry
text: Nice job!  She's hot tonight.  So who are you?  [_Frasier's cell phone rings._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me.  [_He walks back toward the bar and answers his phone._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.  Oh, Dad.  Yeah...Oh, yeah, she's _very_ pretty, and, uh, and nice.  A little _too_ nice, perhaps.  [_Kris sinks another shot and high-fives the admiring collection of men._]  [_Scene 6. Time fade.  Several pool games later.  Frasier is sitting at a table, very bored.  Kris approaches him, holding a cue stick._]

speaker: Kris
text: Frasier, the table only takes quarters.  Would you get some change?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Kris, maybe we should cancel our plans for tonight.

speaker: Kris
text: What?! Why?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you're having such a good time with your crowd here.

speaker: Kris
text: No, I--I just have to teach this one guy a lesson, and then I'm all yours, I promise.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I guess I could ask the bartender for some change.

speaker: Kris
text: Oh, Smitty's too busy.  But try next door at the dry cleaner's.  Tell them it's for me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks for the tip. [_He takes the bill._]

speaker: Kris
text: You are so sweet. [_shouting_] Isn't Frasier sweet, guys?  [_The men shout "Yeah! Frasier! Sweet!" in chorus as he exits the bar. Kris excitedly approaches the pool table again._]  [_Scene 7 - Quick cut to Frasier's apartment, where Martin, Niles, and Daphne are all seated at the dining table._]

speaker: Martin
text: I thought for sure that Frasier was going to hit it off with Kris.  She's really popular in the office!

speaker: Daphne
text: Poor Dr. Crane!  I feel like we failed him.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm not ready to throw in the towel.  There's this woman at the dog park...

speaker: Daphne
text: [_interrupting, to Niles_] Well, if you're going to try again, we should try again too.

speaker: Niles
text: Maybe Frasier had the right attitude by leaving it up to fate.

speaker: Daphne
text: There's nothing wrong with lending a helping hand.  Maybe we were destined to fix him up with someone.

speaker: Niles
text: [_as the voice of wisdom and reason_] No, I'm afraid whatever we wanted for Frasier, fate had other plans.  [_Scene 8 - Quick cut to the dry cleaner. Frasier enters and approaches the clerk at the counter._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, uh, can you give me change for a dollar.

speaker: Andy
text: No change.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's for Kris.

speaker: Andy
text: Oh, yeah, sure!  [_Frasier reacts philosophically.  A woman enters.  It is none other than Lisa, Niles's former patient from the bookstore.  Andy hands Frasier the change._]

speaker: Andy
text: Here you go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  [_He exits without taking any notice of Lisa, who approaches the counter._]

speaker: Andy
text: Hi, Lisa.

speaker: Lisa
text: Oh, Andy.  Can you get out spray paint?

speaker: Andy
text: How did this happen?

speaker: Lisa
text: I was at the new Benjamin Locklear exhibit--and this crazy woman came in and started ranting about how he'd ripped off everything!  Actually, I don't know if I should clean it or hold onto it until after she dies. [_Andy does not react to the joke._] You know, because art increases in value after the artist...[_Andy still does not react._] Think you can get this out?  [_Frasier enters again._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, you only gave me three quarters and a nickel.

speaker: Andy
text: Huh, I guess I don't have any more quarters left.  You want your dollar back?

speaker: Lisa
text: Oh, I might have some change! Let me look.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's very kind of you.  [_She looks in her purse.  Frasier does not recognize her at all._]

speaker: Lisa
text: Um, gum, candy. Oh, oh, oh, oh!  There you go. [_She hands him a quarter._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks. Um, say, uh, don't you have a coat?  It's kind of cold outside.

speaker: Lisa
text: [_showing him the claim check_] I just got spray paint on mine. I wanted to get it cleaned as soon as possible.

speaker: Frasier
text: Did you put seltzer on it?

speaker: Lisa
text: Of course.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know a lot of people mistakenly use...

speaker: Both
text: Lemon juice. [_They laugh._]

speaker: Lisa
text: Which never works.

speaker: Frasier
text: No. No, and it attracts bees.

speaker: Lisa
text: I did not know that!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm not exactly certain that it attracts bees, but, I mean, um, it does make sense, doesn't it?

speaker: Lisa
text: Not really, but you say it with such authority, I bought it.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughing and smiling_] Oh...say, uh, do you play pool?

speaker: Lisa
text: [_finding the question strange_] No.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_beguiled_] Neither do I.  Hi, my name is Frasier.  [_He offers his hand.  Lisa takes it._]
